cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, then turning northwest and west-northwest toward the central Louisiana coast, with the center forecast to skim or cross the south-central Louisiana shoreline before sliding westward inland Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning from Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and southeast Louisiana coastline and adjacent Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience sustained tropical-storm to low-end hurricane-force winds (50–75 mph) beginning early Monday, with gusts higher on elevated structures.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–6 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River banks near the port and adjacent Lake Pontchartrain waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 7 inches, producing flash and urban flooding potential around terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes Monday and Monday night; dangerous seas and swells on the lower river approaches impacting navigation.
